State-wide county adult jails have decreased population from 72.4 K to 54.6 K (late Feb to mid April). 3.2 K since April 1.

At least 1700 inmates released from custody in LA county, Sheriff reported approximately 15,000 inmates in county (unclear if this was number before or after releases)
San Francisco reduced its jail population by nearly 25% since March 4th -- combination of releasing inmates and detaining only those who present a "serious risk of physical violence"
San Diego released 300 people as now allowed by Chief Judge ruling moving bail to zero for many crimes

As of March 1, population of the county's three jails has fallen by 838 to 4,451 -- in part due to early releases of medically vulnerable and nonviolent offenders

More than 100 people have been released from Boulder County Jail in Colorado following efforts from the district attorney’s office to reduce the jail population based on preexisting medical conditions and utilizing personal recognizance bonds.
Article says the decrease was "since last month" Number includes 92 people sentenced to misdemeanors
Release was of people in on non-violent charges, including some who were only there because of inability to pay bail
Combination of reasons, including daily hearings to reduce bonds for some.
800 people released follow chief judge ordered bond review process; 60 bailed by Bail Fnd Project

County sheriff, prosecutors, public defenders and the court system have been working together to release some inmates who have nearly finished their sentences. Sheriff said: "We were able to reduce our inmate population by 15 people that way."
Series of commutations by gov, releasing people held for fines and fees, and others described in article (numbers reported in next two rows were backed out of this total -- originally 5584
Governor commuted non-violent felony sentences of people with less than 5 years and underlying medical conditions
48 nonviolent offenders released from Lexington Jail. Many are older or have pre-existing med conditions that make them at at-risk. Over half of the 28 had fewer than 45 days left to serve.

Jail population state wide is down 37%.  York County down 50%.  Cumberland released people within 90 days and in work release. 1800 number taken from PPI: https://www.prisonpolicy.org/profiles/ME.html 2018 data

296 released from County jails and 94 from DOC. Very detailed breakdown of releases by county in linked file.
60 people presenting low risk from Baltimore City jails and prisons
end of sentence accounts for some of reduction.  No information here about what other strategies used
